holds in most cases, so PPSGCN has lower communication overhead than CES-GCN when clients number

is small.
Therefore, we achieve the lowest memory and communication overhead without introducing redundant memory of feature data in the training process. For BDS-GCN

, the reason for their lower communication overhead is that they reduce communication overhead by introducing redundant memory of boundary node features in different devices. In fact, BDS-GCN could be seen as a specific option in our sampling step where
otherwise. Moreover, through results shown in

, sampling technique largely reduces both training and memory overhead and makes GCN training more scalable in distributed setting. Furthermore, subgraph sampling methods (PPSGCN, BDS-GCN) better mitigate neighbour explosion problems and improve training efficiency with lower communication and memory overhead, compared to node sampling. Besides, our proposed PPSGCN is the only method that achieves the goal of preserving data privacy.

references: In this section, we empirically evaluate the proposed PPSGCN with three prevalent node classification tasks and compare it with various centralized and distributed GCN training methods on both model performance and training overhead. We also conduct ablation study and analyze the effect of batch size and normalization.
